intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I got it.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike, just a bit more...Would you mind hearing my report on our last battle?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Uh, sure. Go ahead, please.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...This can only mean one thing: the enemy knows exactly how we are going to move. With your permission, I'll begin an investigation to see if there's anyone suspicious among the troops......Ike?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike? Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hm? , yes...Sorry. What is it?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Nothing. I was just giving you the standard update. Shall I put it off till later?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No, sorry, but can you start over from the beginning? I'll pay attention this time.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Understood.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Good morning, you two. What's wrong, Ike? You look so sleepy!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I've...had a lot on my mind. I meant to sleep last night, but I was up thinking. Before I knew it, it was morning.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Really? I never thought I'd hear that. Ike didn't sleep because he was thinking. I wonder if Soren will start being polite...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Listen, Titania... Can I just--

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: B-Brother! Ike!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What's wrong, Mist?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: What am I going to do, Ike? My medallion's gone!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? It's gone?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: No!!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: What am I going to do? It was my only memento of Mother--

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Did you drop it? Or put it somewhere and forget? Something like that?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: No! I always carry it with me! I would never lose it! I had it before I went to bed last night... It vanished while I was sleeping! Sniff...waaaa...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Don't cry. It's not your fault.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: But...but...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I said don't cry! I'll find it! All right?!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: All...right... Sorry...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike, just a bit more...Would you mind hearing my report on our last battle?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Uh, sure. Go ahead, please.

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: A-are you serious?

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: You are to begin immediately.

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: Yet, that's... General Petrine! If we do this thing, Daein will suffer.

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: It's for the good of the country. Besides, it's only one territory! Stop mewling like an old woman.

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: I hear you, and yet...If the goal is merely to stop the Crimean army, this is not necessary. The strength of my troops will suffice to--

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: The last idiot who told me that ended up on a corpse pile! Now listen to me, and listen well. No matter how passionate you are when you tell me you'll defeat Crimea, I'll never pin my hopes on a bunch of foreigners. All you have to do is stop their forward progress. That's all. My plan will accomplish this.

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: General Petrine! Do you truly think so little of us? It's true that we were born in Begnion and not Daein, but my men and I have been loyal to this country for eighteen years. We have spared no effort to learn all the proper manners and customs of this land. But now, after all of that, to be dismissed as a bunch of foreigners...

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: No one asked how long you've lived here. Want to know why? Because no one cares! Certainly not me! Where were you born? Huh? Where were you raised? Ha! This country doesn't need squatters like you! The only people Daein can count on in times of crisis are Daeins themselves! Everyone else is just gutter leavings!

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: So we're useless...Is that what you're saying?

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: You tell me, migrant! Why is it that your unit, which was trained to be an elite royal guard, is here patrolling this hick-infested backwater? The answer's clear to me! How about you?

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: Oh, I'm sorry... Am I offending you? Well, here's your chance to show us your worth. Halt Crimea's advance! If you are as skilled as you claim, you should be able to limit the damage to its bare minimum, should you not?

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: Grrr...

intro.speaker: Petrine
intro.line: Hmph! Angry is a good look for you. I look forward to seeing the results of your work. Get going, outlander.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: G-General Shiharam... Must we truly go through with this? It's such a horrific act! It's only recently that the citizens hereabouts have even come to trust us.

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: We have no choice but to obey. It's as the woman says. The only thing we can do is ensure the Crimean army is defeated as soon as possible.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: General--

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: Open the floodgates. DO IT NOW!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike, were you able to find the medallion?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No. It's gone. I fear that Daein may have somehow stolen it.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What? Is such a thing possible?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don't know to what degree, but there can be no questioning Daein's involvment.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Is the medallion...special?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Yes...Oh, yes...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...I beg your pardon.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My question may have touched a sensitive area.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Oh, no... It's not that I don't want to discuss it with you personally. I just can't really talk about it to anyone. It's a private matter.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Ah, I see.

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: Ike.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it, Ulki?

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: I hear the sound of rushing water just ahead. A lot of it.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Rushing water?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: According to the map, there's a large river up ahead.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That must be what you hear.

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: This is unnatural. Warped. It is not the sound of a normal river...

intro.speaker: Begnion Soldier
intro.line: General Ike! Sir, we've got trouble! The road ahead is blocked by water!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What? How can that be?

intro.speaker: Begnion Soldier
intro.line: Perhaps a local river has flooded. The whole region is soaking wet.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Is the road completely impassable?

intro.speaker: Begnion Soldier
intro.line: No, sir! We can move forward, but the water's turned the ground to mud. And the water is still flowing at a tremendous rate, sir! This is going to cut back our speed dramatically.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: This is the work of Daein. They thought to impede our progress in order to gain some time for themselves. And they've succeeded.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Blast! Is there nothing we can do?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Well... If they were able to flood the road only when we approached, there must be floodgates in the area.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So if we can close them, we'll shut off the flow of water, right? That makes sense. Let's get some scouts looking for gates.

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: What's that? Hey, if you're looking for something, leave it to me. I AM the hawk king's eyes, after all!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: These peepers of mine can see for miles and miles. They're quite handy. It would be a shame not to use them.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Is that some laguz power? You're a hawk with the eyes of a...hawk?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: It beats your fantastic wit! My eyesight isn't a racial ability, it's just my own natural talent. Heck, my pal Ulki has ears that can hear grass growing on the other side of the country.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I see. Well then, the job's yours. Do you think you can find the floodgates?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: I just look for some openings with a lot of water pouring out, right? Yeah, I can handle that!

intro.speaker: Shiharam
intro.line: The Crimean army is here! All troops! Combat formations! Hit them fast and hard! We can't let this battle drag out!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So those are the floodgates.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: If we can get them closed, the water will recede in about twelve hours or so.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, let's get going!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you all right? You look rather pale.

intro.speaker: Jill
intro.line: Oh, General Ike...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it? Mist is worried that you're not feeling well.

intro.speaker: Jill
intro.line: To be honest... The man leading the enemy forces, General Shiharam...He's my father.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? Hmm... That's not good. Do you really want to face your father in combat?

intro.speaker: Jill
intro.line: I joined this army based on my own convictions. I think I can meet my father with my head held high.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, if you're sure... Just remember, if you change your mind, let me know. There's no need for you to be in the vanguard if you don't want to be.

intro.speaker: Jill
intro.line: Thank you...

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Lady Jill, is that you? What are you doing with the Crimeans?

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: I'm sorry... I've chosen the path that's right for me.

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Pah! You would betray your own father?

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: You...traitor!

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: My lady Jill... No...Why does this have to be...

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Ge-General! How long are the floodgates to remain open?

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Until the Crimean army has been defeated.

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Sir! If we wait that long, all of the neighboring farmland will be drowned! The locals are already quite upset. They may not abide this much further.

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: General!

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: Enough, soldier! If you've got the time to be bellyaching, take your butt out to the battlefield and kill some Crimean soldiers.

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Captain Haar! Do you support this action? This is inhumane! Lives will be ruined! Daein citizens will die! Even if we claim that it's necessary in order to achieve victory... This is too much!

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: This is Daein's way. Are you ready to disobey the king and be put to the death for your troubles?

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: I would rather die than kill innocent Daein civilians.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: If you're executed as a traitor to the throne, your parents and siblings will also pay. Are you still prepared?

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: Now do you understand what I'm trying to tell you? Go. Fight bravely.

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: ...Y-yes, sir!

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: To gain the trust of the king, we've become cruel and heartless. First hunting and executing the laguz...And now flooding the lands these people call home?

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: General Shiharam... If someone hears you use the word laguz in this country, you'll be branded a traitor.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Hmm...you're right as always. To live in this land, where laguz prejudice is so virulent, we've had to seal away everything we know and teach our children to hate all sub-humans. All that just to survive here.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: It's Ashnard's fault this country has become what it is today. Ah, what a terrible miscalculation we made...Even so, I... I hated the idea of furthering the corruption of the imperial senate. I will continue to support your reasons for leaving Begnion.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: ...I wonder if Jill has distanced herself from the Crimean forces.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: I did...give her warning.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Above all else, I would like to avoid meeting my daughter in combat.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: I pray that she does not take to the field this day. Knowing her temperament, talking with you would only increase both of your sorrows.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: I have but one favor to ask of you.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: Say it, and it will be done.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Do not fight today.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: What?

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Only one side can win a battle. If we are defeated in the end, I want you to care for the survivors and their families.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: ...Yes, sir...Commander Shiharam.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Commander... It's been many a long year since you last called me that.

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: May the fortunes of war be with you. Through all that's...happened... It's been an honor to serve with you.

battle.speaker: Shiharam
battle.line: Mmm...

battle.speaker: Soren
battle.line: Ike! It's no use! The water's too high!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: I...wasn't fast enough... No!

battle.speaker: Titania
battle.line: Ike... We must retreat! I'm sorry, but...we lose.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: How can this be? Father...forgive me.

boss-talk.speaker: Jill
boss-talk.line: Why...Why are you doing this terrible thing? You must close the floodgates now! The fields will be lost, but there may be time to save the homes.

boss-talk.speaker: Shiharam
boss-talk.line: If you wish to stop the water, you must defeat your father. That is...the...only way...

boss-talk.speaker: Jill
boss-talk.line: What is it? There has to be a reason! I know that an act like this cannot be what you desire.

boss-talk.speaker: Shiharam
boss-talk.line: ...Jill, you must leave. Please! If you can't do that, then slay me! There's no more time!

boss-talk.speaker: Jill
boss-talk.line: ...Very well! In that case, I will fight with you.

boss-talk.speaker: Jill
boss-talk.line: Not as a soldier of Daein, but as one of your soldiers. I will fight.

boss-talk.speaker: Shiharam
boss-talk.line: Jill, calm yourself. You mustn't get caught up in the emotions of the moment and lose your way.

boss-talk.speaker: Jill
boss-talk.line: Joining the Crimean army opened my eyes. For the first time, I was able to think about what I fight for. Until that moment, I only did as I was ordered...It was all for fame and glory. Now I finally understand. I fight for those I wish to protect. Father, I want to fight for you.

boss-talk.speaker: Shiharam
boss-talk.line: Even if you come to regret it?

boss-talk.speaker: Jill
boss-talk.line: Yes. I'm prepared for that. I...Jill Fizzart, hereby return myself to the command of General Shiharam. What are your orders, sir?

visit.speaker: Grandma
visit.line: Hold on, youngster! Who do you think you are? You can't just come barging into people's homes! Let me tell you something! You can ransack my home all you want, but you'll find nothing of value here. All our young men have been dragged off to war, and all that's left are women and children. If it's gold you're after, take that scroll on the floor there. You may be able to sell it. It's just something I picked up, so I don't know if it has any value. But take it anyway, you dirty thief!

visit.speaker: Grandpa
visit.line: You! You filthy Crimean! Get out! Get out now! There's nothing in this shack that would make you happy!

visit.speaker: Grandpa
visit.line: Oh, so you won't leave till you get something, is that it? Here, take this old staff! Now hit the road! You've no need to steal anything else from us! Or will you take my life, as well?! In that last skirmish... My boy, my only son... You stole his life, curse you! I hope you're satisfied!

boss.speaker: Shiharam
boss.line: Neither of us desires a drawn-out battle. Come! Hold nothing back!

end.speaker: Begnion Soldier
end.line: General Ike, sir! The floodgates have been closed!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Soren, what's the damage to the surrounding area?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: It's terrible. All of the fields and homes have been completely destroyed.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I see...

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: ...I don't think this is what the enemy general wanted, either. So why did this have to happen?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It's heartless... What will happen to those who've lost their homes? Can we do anything to help them?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: You want to aid the people of our enemy? That is time and energy we cannot afford.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Soren. Take a portion of our supplies and distribute it among the locals.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: What? Are you serious?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Our opponent is the Daein army. We've no quarrel with these people.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Ike, I know you feel for these people, but this is war! We don't have--

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I don't know what it will accomplish, Soren. But, moving on without lifting a finger is something I cannot do.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: I understand. I'd rather regret something I had done than regret taking no action at all.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I would like to help, too. Perhaps I can aid the injured.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: ...Idiocy...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Well, that's that. We gained some time by flooding the river, but it won't hold them for long. I knew that foreign cur was useless... It looks like the decisive battle will be fought near the capital.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Preparations are complete, General Petrine. In order to ease command for you, Sir Bryan will serve as your deputy. Regarding strategy, it would be easiest if you spoke with him directly--

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Sorry to tell you this, Ena, but I'm not the one who'll be directing our forces in the capital.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Will it be the Black Knight then? Hmm...the plans must be adjusted slightly. I'll select someone else to act as deputy...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: No. Not him either. His Majesty wishes you to direct the defenses, Ena.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Me? I am to take command...of the army?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: That's right. You're moving up in the world, General Ena.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: I...it's too much for me... I must confirm this with the king...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Ha! What a rare sight this is. I've never seen you so flustered! Listen, if you wish to meet with His Majesty, you must fulfill your duties. He's ordered that there be no communications until that time.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: I'm a bit late.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Well, if it isn't the big Black Knight! It's been such a long time. You're always so very busy, aren't you? Here one day, there the next... Your secret maneuvers are--

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: They are proof of the trust His Majesty has placed in me. Ena, go to the east gate. You have a visitor.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Very well...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Is it the Worm? Did he bring it with him?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: It appears so. He insists that he give it directly over to Ena, though.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Hmph! As long as it is ours, it makes no difference.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: When Ena returns, you will be the one to take it directly to the king. Show care that it is not unwrapped on the way there. That could be...unfortunate.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: I don't need to be told that! More importantly, what will you do now?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Me? I will...

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: Ena... Have you been well?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Where is Lehran's Medallion?

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: Right here. Take it, please.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: It feels so heavy...and it's not all the wrapping, either. Could this be the chaotic energy... of an evil god?

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: So, you can now return to King Ashnard's side, can you not?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: No. Not yet.

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: I've been entrusted with the defense of the capital. I...must face the Crimean army.

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: No!

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Thank you. You've done so much for me...But now, it's... It's enough. Please...Reclaim your freedom. There's no need for you to follow Daein's orders any longer.

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: And you? Do you mean to die?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: No... I cannot retreat. Even if I have to slaughter the entire Crimean army... I will return to him...

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: Yet he thinks nothing of you...

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: That matters not. The only place I belong is at his side. I will most likely never see you again... I will pray for your eternal happiness.

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: Ena! Wait!

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Forget about me. That is my final request. Farewell...Nasir.

end.speaker: Jill
end.line: Oh, Father...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Jill... No matter the reasons, I'm the one who took your father from you. I can't use this war as an excuse.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: If you want revenge on me for your father, I understand. You have...that right.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Once you've had some time to think things through, let me know what you will do. I'd like to have you stay with us, but... It's really up to you. That's all I had to say.

end.speaker: Jill
end.line: ...Sniff. ...Sn...sniff......

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: One, two, three... Five in all. We're lucky to have that many.

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Captain Haar... What are we supposed to do now? General Shiharam is dead, and our homes are gone. What are we to do with our families?

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: What do you want to do? We've lost any right we had to stay here. So that leaves Begnion or Crimea...

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: General Shiharam was slain by Crimea...Joining with them now is not...It's not possible.

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: Then all you can do is return to Begnion. I doubt you'll get a hero's welcome, but...I've an old friend in the pegasus knights. Shall I contact her?

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Sniff... Ah, gods. Eighteen long years...What does any of it mean now?

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: Don't say that! No matter what, I'm proud to have served under General Shiharam.

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: You're right... It was an honor...

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Yoo-hoo! You there! Young man! I have business with the general of this army. Would you convey a message?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Who are you?

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: ...Who am I? What kind of low-born greeting is that? My name is Calill, and I am a first-class mage.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And what would a first-class mage want with this army?

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: What's your problem? You look as if you don't believe me! Well,  suppose I can't hold that against you...It's not often you find beauty like this coupled with intelligence like mine. But it's true nonetheless.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A mage, huh? Well, I guess you can never have too many mages lying around.

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Oh, and as a bonus, I'm quite skilled with a knife, as well. Beauty, brains, and brawn... Sigh! The goddess has seen fit to put the abilities of three people into one delectable package.Sounds like favoritism, doesn't it? A...Um...hellooooo? Are you listening to me? There's a beautiful woman talking!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah, the point is that you want to join the Crimean army, right? How much are you planning to charge?

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Well, aren't you the little businessman? Let's see... How does free sound?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Suspicious. What's the catch?

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: I like my fees to be based on performance. Watch how I do in combat, and make me an offer.Depending on what it is, I'll decide whether or not to grace you with my assistance.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're not lacking for confidence, are you?

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Of course not! I already told you, I'm a first-class mage.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right, you're in.

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: What? Are you allowed to make decisions like that on your own? Perhaps I should speak to the general!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I am the general.

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Whaaaaaat?!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Reyson! Could you come down here for a moment?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: What do you need?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I've got something I want to ask you about.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: If I can help, I will.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Your... Your ancestors............

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Forget it. It's nothing.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: What? Is something wrong?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I apologize. Please let it go.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: It seems like something important has happened, but if you do not want to discuss it, that is your right.However, if this weren't a battlefield, your secret might not be safe. Please take care in the future.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What do you mean?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: We of the heron clan...If we choose to, we can read the thoughts of others.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Seriously?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: However, this power is only available to us in a calm and peaceful environment.Here, in this desperate maelstrom of chaotic emotion, it avails me not. Energy here is warped and distorted.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You know, now that you mention it...Reyson, are you feeling sick?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're so pale that it's hard to tell, but I think your face looks more wan than usual.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: Pay it no mind. I'm...fine.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You've got nothing to prove. Why don't you stay off the battlefield for a while?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: Ike! I'm fine, I promise. Please, do not give me special treatment.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: As far as giving you special treatment goes, I don't really have a choice.I promised King Phoenicis I wouldn't push you too hard.If anything were to happen to you, I'd be at war with Daein and the bird clans at the same time!

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: ...I see.I came to repay my debt, but I'm really just being a burden.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That was not my intention. Hold on a moment! Who said anything about you being a burden?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: I cannot engage in combat, so I'm nothing more than an obstacle in the field.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Reyson, no! That's absurd! Don't you understand how useful your abilities are?No one else can do the things that you can. You're irreplaceable.So if you're not feeling well and try to do too much, you may not be there when we really need you.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: I'm of use to you, then?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That's what I've been trying to tell you. We depend on you, and that's why I need to make sure you stay healthy.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: In that case... I wouldn't mind taking a short break. But you can call me anytime. I'll come right away.
